poem:
Title: Silver Bellied Echo of Youth

Like a quilt stitched from years pacified,
Yet, folded to reveal its other side, 
Violet, dances with a newfound tide.
Her once color-drained smile, now the sun, bemused.
In the eyes of Oliver, she takes her youth's claim,
As they sway in a rhythm, shaming the time's game,
Proof, that passion's not exclusive to the flame.
